titles.title: 14th/14 Amendment Interstate Highway Initiation Act of 2005
14th/14 Amendment Interstate Highway Initiation Act of 2005
To require a study and report regarding the construction and designation of a new Interstate from Augusta, Georgia to Natchez, Mississippi.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways, Transit and Pipelines.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: 14th/14 Amendment Interstate Highway Initiation Act - Directs the Secretary of Transportation to study and report to the appropriate congressional committees on the steps and estimated funding necessary to designate and construct a new interstate route (Interstate Route I-14) for the 14th Amendment Highway, from Augusta, Georgia, to Natchez, Mississippi, (formerly designated the Fall Line Freeway within the State of Georgia).
